intro: Microsteira paniculata, commonly known as the panicled microsteira, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Microsteira paniculata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
